question: How do the Wari’ rationalize or define endocannibalism versus exocannibalism?

answers.text: Endocannibalism is the eating of animals, and exocannibalism is the eating of humans.
Endocannibalism is the eating of humans, while exocannibalism is the eating of animals.
Endocannibalism is the eating of humans who are not of one’s group, while exocannibalism is the eating of members of one’s own group.
Endocannibalism is the eating of members of one’s own group, while exocannibalism is the eating of humans and animals outside one’s group.
